instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2850 not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message:
this board came in with classic c9560 problem ( crashing intermittently ).
after c9560 problem, customer came a few weeks later with not going to sleep when closing the lid problem.
smc_lid is 3.4v.
using another known good logicboard in the case, the sleep work, so we can discard part problem.

everytime  i plug magsafe, u8000 isgetting warm, and sometimes theres a fan spin ( even though i dont press / trigger power button ).
any idea where to look for ?
is the keyboard button stuck hence mac wont go to sleep?

threads.title: 820-2850 not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message: r8750 is corroded, re tin the resistor, value is normal. but still same.

threads.title: 820-2850 not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message:
Hall sensor is placed into BIL, connected to J6955.
Check R6961.

threads.title: 820-2850 not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message: r6961 is good, there's 3.3v at both side.

threads.title: 820-2850 not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message:
Should drop to 0V, when lid is closed.
You can test approaching a magnet to the sensor placed on the BIL.
If another MLB worked on the same shell, then the sensor is good.

Should have bad trace, or contact problem at J6955.
Don't forget to check 3V42_G3H contacts...
